title: How to Bake Carrot Cake Cupcakes

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees.
steps.description: Be sure to adjust baking racks to the middle of the oven, to ensure an even baking throughout the cupcakes.

steps.headline: Start by measuring out all the ingredients into separate bowls.
steps.description: This will allow you to visualize all the ingredients before adding to the mixture, as well as keep the process organized.

steps.headline: Gather dry ingredients first.
steps.description: In a large stand mixer bowl combine sugars, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Be sure that the baking powder as well as baking soda is thoroughly incorporated into the dry mixture because this will allow the cake to rise evenly when baking.

steps.headline: Add the carrots, oil, eggs, and vanilla.
steps.description: Beat this mixture with the paddle attachment for 2 to 3 minutes at a medium to high speed.

steps.headline: Still using the paddle, turn the speed down to a simple stir and add nuts.
steps.description: Allow the mixer to thoroughly incorporate nuts before turning off the mixer.

steps.headline: Assemble three muffin tins lined with paper cupcake cups.
steps.description: Fill each cup about 3/4 full with batter. You may wish to use an ice cream scoop for no-mess pouring.

steps.headline: Place filled tins into the oven and bake for about 40 minutes or until the cakes look spongy and brown.
After pulling them from the oven, allow cakes to cool on a wire rack.
To make the icing, place cream cheese, butter, and vanilla extract in a large bowl.
steps.description: Be sure that each of these ingredients are at room temperature so that they are soften, and combine more easily. Beat at a low speed until smooth and creamy, about 3-4 minutes. Add confectioner's sugar gradually, beating until smooth. Add more sugar to thicken or milk and/or water to thin the frosting, as needed.

steps.headline: Frost the cupcakes.
steps.description: At this point, cupcakes should be cool enough to frost. Choose piping bag with your desired decorative tip and fill with the cream cheese frosting. Starting in the middle of the cake, push down slightly and swirl out to the sides. Garnish the top of the frosting with whole pecans or orange sprinkles.

text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Be sure to adjust baking racks to the middle of the oven, to ensure an even baking throughout the cupcakes. Start by measuring out all the ingredients into separate bowls. This will allow you to visualize all the ingredients before adding to the mixture, as well as keep the process organized. Gather dry ingredients first. In a large stand mixer bowl combine sugars, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Be sure that the baking powder as well as baking soda is thoroughly incorporated into the dry mixture because this will allow the cake to rise evenly when baking. Add the carrots, oil, eggs, and vanilla. Beat this mixture with the paddle attachment for 2 to 3 minutes at a medium to high speed. Still using the paddle, turn the speed down to a simple stir and add nuts. Allow the mixer to thoroughly incorporate nuts before turning off the mixer. Assemble three muffin tins lined with paper cupcake cups. Fill each cup about 3/4 full with batter. You may wish to use an ice cream scoop for no-mess pouring. Place filled tins into the oven and bake for about 40 minutes or until the cakes look spongy and brown.  After pulling them from the oven, allow cakes to cool on a wire rack.  To make the icing, place cream cheese, butter, and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Be sure that each of these ingredients are at room temperature so that they are soften, and combine more easily. Beat at a low speed until smooth and creamy, about 3-4 minutes. Add confectioner's sugar gradually, beating until smooth. Add more sugar to thicken or milk and/or water to thin the frosting, as needed. Frost the cupcakes. At this point, cupcakes should be cool enough to frost. Choose piping bag with your desired decorative tip and fill with the cream cheese frosting. Starting in the middle of the cake, push down slightly and swirl out to the sides. Garnish the top of the frosting with whole pecans or orange sprinkles.
